page.title: 06Queens Park, Edinburgh
page.content:
{Arthur's Seat}is a dominant feature of the Edinburgh{landscape.}It was once an active{volcano.}Signs of the ice-age are to be found as ice cracks can be seen in rocks and stones.
To-day there you can hill walk, play football in the surrounding{Queen's {Park,}take part in a marathon, have a school picnic and sledge in winter. You can visit Holyrood Palace or bird watch at Duddingston Loch which is a bird{sanctuary.} The Queen holds garden parties there and every year the miners hold a gala. Paratroopers hold exhibitions- and jump from balloons. At Lochend Park I race my BMX bike round the track. There are boats on the loch and swans nest in the middle. There are many parks in the city centre.
